intro: Campsiandra gomez-alvareziana, commonly known as the Alvareziana camphor tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky substance. It is often found in humid, shaded environments and is valued for its aromatic properties. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
